questions.question: The opera was pleasant but it is one of the composer’s …………………… works.
questions.description: Lesser means smaller or less important.

questions.question: The ruler’s ………………………….. practices led to a popular uprising.
The responsibility ……………………….. with the driver.
questions.description: Lie can mean be placed or remain.

questions.question: A smile …………………………….. up his face.
questions.description: Either lighted or lit can be used as the past tense of light.

questions.question: ………………………… me fifty dollars.
questions.description: The verbs loan and lend are usually interchangeable.

questions.question: A Rolls-Royce is a …………………………. car.
questions.description: Luxurious means expensive or costly. Luxuriant means abundant.

questions.question: The garden has …………………………. foliage.
questions.description: Luxurious means expensive or costly. Luxuriant means abundant.

questions.question: In the distance rose the ………………………………. Alps.
questions.description: Majestic and majestical are both possible here.

questions.question: She has a …………………………… for collecting seashells.
questions.description: A mania is a passion, craze or craving.

questions.question: He has one ………………………. – he is terrified of heights.
questions.description: A phobia is a compulsive fear of something.

questions.question: Only a man of ………………………….. could afford a house that big.
questions.description: Means can mean money or resources. This expression is always used in the plural form.

questions.question: We understood him .................................. his accent.
questions.description: Either despite or in spite of is possible here.
